## Quality Checklist

### Code Quality

- [ ] Code follows project conventions (see CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [ ] Commits follow conventional commits format
- [ ] TypeScript strict mode compliant (no `any` types)
- [ ] No console.log or debugger statements
- [ ] Error handling implemented
- [ ] Edge cases handled

### Documentation

- [ ] Code is self-documenting with clear variable/function names
- [ ] Complex logic includes comments
- [ ] README.md updated (if needed)
- [ ] API.md updated (if API changed)
- [ ] CHANGELOG.md updated
- [ ] JSDoc comments for public functions

### Performance

- [ ] No unnecessary re-renders
- [ ] Appropriate use of memo/useMemo/useCallback
- [ ] Images optimized
- [ ] No performance regressions (Lighthouse score >= 90)

### Security

- [ ] No security vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] User input validated
- [ ] Output encoded/escaped
- [ ] No sensitive data in logs
- [ ] Dependencies audited (`npm audit`)

### Accessibility

- [ ] ARIA labels present
- [ ] Keyboard navigation works
- [ ] Focus management correct
- [ ] Color contrast sufficient (>= 4.5:1)
- [ ] Screen reader tested (if UI changes)

### UI/UX (if applicable)

- [ ] Follows Miami design system
- [ ] Responsive (mobile-first)
- [ ] Touch targets >= 44x44px
- [ ] Loading states implemented
- [ ] Error states implemented
- [ ] Empty states implemented

- [ ] No special deployment steps required
- [ ] Requires environment variable changes (list below)
- [ ] Requires database migration (describe below)
- [ ] Breaking changes (describe impact below)
